recipe.title: Baked Beans with Bacon and Brown Sugar
ingredients: 1 (14- to 15-ounce) can crushed tomatoes in thick purée
2 (19-ounce) cans small white beans, rinsed and drained (4 cups)
1 medium onion, cut crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick slices
instructions: Put oven rack in upper third of oven and preheat oven to 400°F. Stir together tomatoes, brown sugar, mustard, and salt in a bowl. Gently stir in beans and transfer to a 2-quart shallow baking dish. Arrange onion slices in 1 layer over beans, then cover onion with bacon. Bake, uncovered, until bacon is browned and beans have absorbed most of liquid, about 1 1/4 hours.
Put oven rack in upper third of oven and preheat oven to 400°F.
Stir together tomatoes, brown sugar, mustard, and salt in a bowl. Gently stir in beans and transfer to a 2-quart shallow baking dish.
Arrange onion slices in 1 layer over beans, then cover onion with bacon.
Bake, uncovered, until bacon is browned and beans have absorbed most of liquid, about 1 1/4 hours.
